title: Fundamental Theorem with derivative of integral

content.question: Which of the following is an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </math> at the point where x = -1?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
